poem:
**Kilimanjaro's Feast**

On Kilimanjaro's crest,  
plantains and cassava rest,  
bursting with the sun's own wealth,  
unfurling threads of secret health.  
Banana brews ferment and churn,  
a timeless wisdom, slow to learn—  
rural whispers, immune to haste  
in each small bite the old world's taste.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Move over, Med diet – plantains and cassava can be as healthy as tomatoes and olive oil, say researchers Plantains, cassava and fermented banana drink should be added to global healthy eating guidelines alongside the olive oil, tomatoes and red wine of the Mediterranean diet, say researchers who found the traditional diet of people living in Tanzania’s Kilimanjaro region had a positive impact on the body’s immune system. Traditional foods enjoyed in rural villages also". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
